value: A view of Cromwell and Lake Dunstan

, originally known as "The Junction", is a city in central
. It sits right at the confluence of the Clutha and Kawarau Rivers, on the

. The settlement expanded rapidly after 1862, when news went out that gold was discovered nearby. It's surrounded by rather picturesque landscapes, in which both rivers have cut beautiful gorges. It's also knowns for it's vineyards.
are the main roads in and out, with the first connecting to
, while the latter connects north and south to the Lindis Pass and
. The nearest airport is at Queenstown.
Having transportation of your own is most convenient. It's possible to rent cars of -better yet- campervans at the airport. Hiking and biking are great ways to explore the direct surroundings.

content=The blue waters of this man-made reservoir are a popular place for all kinds of water sports and activities. Swimming, fishing, waterskiing and rowing are just a few of your options.

There's a mall with a range of shops. The Paper Plus there offers postal services.
